title: The Mad Bomber of New York
description:
The Mad Bomber of New York - Michael M. Greenburg [epub]

Between 1940 and 1957, 33 bombs (an interesting number) - strategically placed in Grand Central, Penn Station, Radio City Music Hall, Macy's and other populous areas of New York - paralyzed the city,  sending shockwaves of fear through an unsuspecting public.
 George Metesky, the â€œMad Bomber,â€ unleashed a reign of terror that reverberated through America's social, legal, and political landscape, ultimately spurring the birth of modern criminal profiling when a crime psychiatrist was called in to assist in the manhunt.

Compelling historical true crime, The Mad Bomber of New York is the gripping tale of two individuals engaged in a deadly game of hide-and-seek, with the city of New York caught in the crosshairs
